info.name: ðŸ” Aqua Enterprise API
info.description:
Welcome to the **Aqua API Postman Collection** â€“ your one-stop environment to explore, test, and integrate with [Aquaâ€™s Cloud Security APIs](https://www.aquasec.com/). This collection is designed to help developers, DevOps engineers, and security professionals quickly authenticate, query, and interact with Aquaâ€™s key API endpoints in a structured, pre-configured workspace.

### **ðŸš€ Whatâ€™s Included**

- **Authentication flow** with token handling (JWT parsing and storage)
    
- Ready-to-use examples for key APIs
    
- Dynamic environment variables (aqua_url_v1, aqua_url_v2) auto-populated post-login
    
- Modular request groups for easy navigation and testing
    

### **âš™ï¸ How to Use**

1. **Import the Collection** into Postman (use the â€œRun in Postmanâ€ button if available).
    
2. Set your environment variables:
    
    - signin_url
        
    - email
        
    - password
        
3. Run the Login request to automatically parse the JWT and configure base URLs.
    
4. Start exploring Aquaâ€™s APIs using the organized request groups.
    

### **ðŸ’¡ Notes**

- Make sure your user credentials have appropriate permissions in Aqua.
    
- The JWT parsing logic is handled via a pre-script to extract ese_url from csp_metadata and dynamically configure endpoints.
    
- This collection is ideal for both learning and automating integrations with Aquaâ€™s backend services.
    

### **ðŸ’¡ Signin URLs**

For SaaS users, set the "signin_url" variable according to your region.

| **Region** | **URL** |
| --- | --- |
| US | https://api.cloudsploit.com |
| EU | https://eu-1.api.cloudsploit.com |
| Singapore | https://asia-1.api.cloudsploit.com |
| Sydney | https://ap-2.api.cloudsploit.com |

request.description: This request will generate a bearer token with a specified time to live value that can be enhanced in the body at your convinience. It will set global variables for signature, timestamp and environment variables for token and aqua_saas_endpoint.

This request will generate a bearer token with a specified time to live value that can be enhanced in the body at your convinience. It will set global variables for signature, timestamp and environment variables for token and aqua_saas_endpoint.

item.description:
You can authenticate against Aqua SaaS using two methods:

- User name (email) and Password
    
- API Key and Secret
    

If using the API Key and Secret, please make sure the API Key is not Global Admin. You will need to disable the "Global Admin" toggle, and then choose two specific permissions from the list: role:assign and tokens:readwrite
